md:
giải nghĩa từ "brief" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ đồng nghĩa.

* Brief (noun)
	+ Meaning: A short document or report that gives the main points of a situation or problem.
	+ Example: The lawyer submitted a brief to the court outlining the key arguments in the case.
	+ Related words: summary, report, document
	+ Synonyms: concise, succinct, summary

* Brief (verb)
	+ Meaning: To give someone a summary of the main points of a situation or problem.
	+ Example: The manager briefed the team on the new project.
	+ Related words: inform, update, summarize
	+ Synonyms: inform, advise, instruct

* Brief (adjective)
	+ Meaning: Short and to the point.
	+ Example: The brief instructions were easy to follow.
	+ Related words: concise, succinct, short
	+ Synonyms: concise, succinct, terse
html:
giải nghĩa từ "brief" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ đồng nghĩa.

  • Brief (noun)

    • Meaning: A short document or report that gives the main points of a situation or problem.
    • Example: The lawyer submitted a brief to the court outlining the key arguments in the case.
    • Related words: summary, report, document
    • Synonyms: concise, succinct, summary

  • Brief (verb)

    • Meaning: To give someone a summary of the main points of a situation or problem.
    • Example: The manager briefed the team on the new project.
    • Related words: inform, update, summarize
    • Synonyms: inform, advise, instruct

  • Brief (adjective)

    • Meaning: Short and to the point.
    • Example: The brief instructions were easy to follow.
    • Related words: concise, succinct, short
    • Synonyms: concise, succinct, terse
